It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Appendicula hooglandii is considered a species of conservation concern.
